com.github.epadronu.balin.config

Class Configuration

  • com.github.epadronu.balin.config.Configuration
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConfigurationSetup

    public class Configuration
implements ConfigurationSetup

    This class defines a special kind of configuration setup that may contain other configuration setups, to be used according to the balin.setup.name system property.

    val developmentConfigurationSetup = Configuration(false, testFactory)

val desiredConfigurationSetup = ConfigurationBuilder().apply {
    driverFactory = testFactory

    setups = mapOf(
        "development" to developmentConfigurationSetup
    )
}.build()

System.setProperty(Browser.BALIN_SETUP_NAME_PROPERTY, "development")

Browser.drive(desiredConfigurationSetup) {
    Assert.assertEquals(configurationSetup, developmentConfigurationSetup)
}

    See Also:
    interface ConfigurationSetup

    • Constructor Detail

      • Configuration

        public Configuration(boolean autoQuit,
                     kotlin.jvm.functions.Function0<? extends org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver> driverFactory,
                     long waitForSleepTimeInMilliseconds,
                     long waitForTimeOutTimeInSeconds,
                     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,? extends com.github.epadronu.balin.config.ConfigurationSetup> setups)

        Creates a new configuration setup

        Parameters:
        autoQuit - control whether the driver quits at the end of Browser.Companion.drive.
        driverFactory - the factory that will create the driver to be used when invoking Browser.Companion.drive.
        waitForSleepTimeInMilliseconds - control the amount of time between attempts when using WaitingSupport.waitFor.
        waitForTimeOutTimeInSeconds - control the total amount of time to wait for a condition evaluated by WaitingSupport.waitFor to hold.
        setups - may contain configuration setups to be used according to the balin.setup.name system property.

        Creates a new configuration setup
